Authors:
Thiyagaraja Vinodhini, Ertz Damien, Kevin D Hyde, Samantha
Karunarathna, To-anun Chaiwat, Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon
Title:
Morphological and phylogenetic reassessment of Sclerococcum
simplex from China
Abstract:
Sclerococcum is one of the species rich lichenicolous
genus in Ascomycota. However, many species of Sclerococcum have been
identified based only on morphology. This study provides sequences for
large-subunit ribosomal RNA (LSU), internal transcribed spacer (ITS) and
mitochondrial small-subunit ribosomal RNA (mtSSU) for the first time for
Sclerococcum simplex and the first geographical record of the genus from
China. The phylogenetic analyses of Maximum likelihood (ML) and Bayesian
inference (BI) confirmed S. simplex clustered within Sclerococcum sensu
stricto while the genus was recovered as polyphyletic in
Dactylosporaceae. Our strain of Sclerococcum simplex in its asexual
state was collected on Pertusaria host thallus growing on bark. The
taxonomic affinity of S. simplex is investigated based on phylogenetic
and morphological evidence.
